ur words and when mentioning your research. Cognitive functioning or proces=
sing sensory information in order to come to a conclusion or judgement is h=
ow we function in this world. In order for your mind to understand this phy=
sical world you live in it automatically makes certain assumptions about se=
nsory information it takes in. Your eyes expect to see objects oriented cor=
rectly, with the correct color, lighting, reflectivity and shading, and you=
 expect there size and shape to be within scale compared to other objects. =
My point is your senses have a range, which implies limitations. Since this=
 is correct for your senses it is also correct for your ability to understa=
nd perspectives with any wide ranging diversity. You are able to see and pr=
ocess the information of our physical world just as any other human being d=
oes. That is great for a human but why would you think for a second,
 you c=
ould understand the perspective=A0of a mind and=A0 voice that speaks throug=
h a radio from some unknown location.

ow what perspective it is coming from. You are making a lot of unfounded as=
